707-720-990
IMPORTANT INFORMATION
FOR OUR ASTROJET PASSENGERS
Even though you may be an experienced air traveler, there are certain
features of this Astrojet with which you may not be familiar.
AMERICAN AIRLINES
AUTOMATIC OXYGEN SYSTEM
The higher altitudes at which this aircraft operates require the prompt
use of the automatic oxygen system in case of any sudden change in
cabin pressure. Should a decompression occur, oxygen masks will
drop down. Take nearest mask and promptly place over nose and
mouth.
NO SMOKING
BREATHE
NORMALLY
BRACING POSITIONS
FORWARD
FSEING
REAR
FACING
SCATI
SEAT BELTS
Even if the "SEAT BELT"
sign is turned off in flight,
it is recommended that
you keep your seat belt
loosely fastened, when-
ever you are in your seat.
FLOTATION SEAT
CUSHIONS
The cushion on which you
are sitting is designed to
keep you afloat. In the event
of a water landing, grasp the
cushion at the rear, pull it
forward and take it with you.
AA Form OP100-B
PLEASE SEE REVERSE SIDE

707-720-990
IMPORTANT INFORMATION
FOR OUR ASTROJET PASSENGERS
AMERICAN AIRLINES
EMERGENCY EXITS
There is a minimum of six exits provided for your use. The chart below
will show you the one closest to your seat. The exits over the wings
are removable windows. For easier exit through one of these windows.
the backrest of the seat just ahead of the window should be pushed
forward. The two exits at each end of the cabin are doors equipped
with fast operating evacuation slides.

properties.sfomuseum:description: Safety information card issued by American Airlines for the Boeing 707, 720, and Convair 990; blue and white double-sided laminated card with illustrations and text demonstrating safety instructions and emergency procedures; information code OP100-B.
